newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan, Kuwait to study ways to recover more oil.
newsitem.headline: Japan, Kuwait to study ways to recover more oil.

text.p: Japan National Oil Corp (JNOC) said on Wednesday it had agreed with Kuwait to jointly research ways to enhance crude oil recovery from existing fields.

State-owned JNOC and the Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research hope to come up with technology which would increase recoverable reserves from oil fields by about five to 20 percent but without hurting profitability, JNOC said.
JNOC said it hopes to strengthen ties with major oil producer Kuwait, through the research.
Kuwait produces about two million barrels per day (bpd) of crude, of which Japan imports about 230,000 bpd, JNOC said.
